message.content:
{"id": "123523", 
"title": "Bug 123523 - Previewing a scripted data set mapped to a java event handler throws Null Pointer Exception (NPE)", 
"description": "(See ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath). The context will be null in this case. The reason for using the context is to use cached class loaders when possible. We can either provide an external map to use as cache, or not bother with caching at all.", 
"OB": "When previewing a scripted data set mapped to a java event handler, a Null Pointer Exception (NPE) is thrown in the ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath method. This occurs when the context is null.", 
"EB": "The software should handle the situation when the context is null and avoid throwing a Null Pointer Exception. Instead, it should either provide an external map to use as cache or not perform any caching at all.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue: \n1. Open the software and navigate to the scripted data set preview section. \n2. Configure the scripted data set to be mapped to a java event handler. \n3. Attempt to preview the data set. \n4. Note that a Null Pointer Exception is thrown in the ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath method when the context is null."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '123523', 'title': 'Bug 123523Previewing a scripted data set mapped to a java event handler throws NPE', 'description': '(See ScriptExecutor.getClassUsingCustomClassPath). The context will be null in this case. The reason for using the context is to use cached class loaders when possible. We can either provide an external map to use as cache, or not bother with caching at all. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'When previewing a scripted data set we try to get a class loader from the ExecutionContext. '}
